newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - July 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - July 7.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Police say separatist Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) killed parliament member from moderate Tamil United Liberation Front (TULF). Arunasalam Thangathurai and four others were killed in a grenade attack in eastern Trincomalee on Saturday.

Four spectators wounded when two racing cars crashed and ran off the road during motor races in the hill capital of Kandy over the weekend. Motor races in scenic Kandy were resumed this summer after a lapse of many years.
Navy destroys two LTTE boats off the northern Jaffna peninsula early Sunday morning. More than 30 rebels were believed killed in the attack.
Military intelligence officers take four suspected LTTE rebels into custody in connection with the killing of a Tamil MP and four others in Trincomalee.
Police in Colombo suburb of Piliyandala arrest a young mother of three who allegedly led a gang of robbers responsible for at least 18 robberies and hold-ups in the area.
